comment:
* Data about a brightness settings change.
 *
 * {@see DisplayManager.getBrightnessEvents()}
 * @hide

variables.name: packageName
userId
variables.comment:
User id of of the user running when brightness was changed.
     * @hide

variables.name: luxValues
variables.comment: Lux values of recent sensor data

variables.name: luxTimestamps
variables.comment: Timestamps of the lux sensor readings {@see System.currentTimeMillis()}

variables.name: batteryLevel
variables.comment: Most recent battery level when brightness was changed or Float.NaN

variables.name: powerBrightnessFactor
variables.comment: Factor applied to brightness due to battery level, 0.0-1.0

variables.name: nightMode
variables.comment: Color filter active to provide night mode

variables.name: colorTemperature
variables.comment: If night mode color filter is active this will be the temperature in kelvin

variables.name: isDefaultBrightnessConfig
variables.comment: Whether brightness configuration is default version

variables.name: isUserSetBrightness
variables.comment: Whether brightness curve includes a user brightness point

variables.name: colorValueBuckets
variables.comment:
* Histogram counting how many times a pixel of a given value was displayed onscreen for the
     * Value component of HSV if the device supports color sampling, if the device does not support
     * color sampling or {@link BrightnessConfiguration#shouldCollectColorSamples()} is false the
     * value will be null.
     *
     * The buckets of the histogram are evenly weighted, the number of buckets is device specific.
     * The units are in pixels * milliseconds, with 1 pixel millisecond being 1 pixel displayed
     * for 1 millisecond.
     * For example if we had {100, 50, 30, 20}, value component was onscreen for 100 pixel
     * milliseconds in range 0x00->0x3F, 30 pixel milliseconds in range 0x40->0x7F, etc.
     *
     * {@see #colorSampleDuration}

variables.name: colorSampleDuration
variables.comment:
* How many milliseconds of data are contained in the colorValueBuckets, if the device does
     * not support color sampling or {@link BrightnessConfiguration#shouldCollectColorSamples()} is
     * false the value will be 0L.
     *
     * {@see #colorValueBuckets}

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public void writeToParcel(Parcel dest, int flags)
